description: My preferred UNIX desktop, Common Desktop Environment on OpenBSD. (Just kidding, I usually use KDE nowadays - but this is more than usable, despite being older than I am! Go check it out and compile it for yourself.)
Vx, a simple Motif program manager. Pick a program group, choose your program, optionally edit the command and go. Implements the Model-View-Controller paradigm... in plain C.
DtApm is a Motif-based applet for OpenBSD and Common Desktop Environment, reusing code from the 'apm' command to monitor system battery life.
GenOS demonstrating its support for virtual consoles. Both the video display and serial TTY are accessed by the same interface.
The current state of my hobbyist operating system - I will probably redo most of it from scratch someday.
Header background image for this very website!
